item.title: 美国银行押注欧洲股权销售，同时在首次公开募股领域处于领先地位
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp. ）正寻求在欧洲建立其股票资本市场专营权，即使在今年参与该地区一些最大的首次公开募股时，任何交易都不会太小。【原文：Bank of America Corp. is looking to build out its equity capital markets franchise in Europe, and even as it works on some of the region’s largest initial public offerings this year, no deal is too small.】

item.title: 凯雷为最大的日本收购基金融资 28 亿美元
item.description: 尽管全球私募股权公司的筹资环境黯淡，凯雷集团公司（Carlyle Group Inc.【原文：Carlyle Group Inc. raised 430 billion yen ($2.8 billion) for its fifth Japan buyout fund, adding to signs of investor interest in the country despite a gloomy fundraising climate for private equity firms globally.】

item.title: 风险较高的日元债券保持强劲势头，收益率有望走高
item.description: 日元企业债券的强劲势头表明，市场对风险较高、期限较短、不易受加息影响的债券有很好的胃口。【原文：A strong pipeline of yen corporate bonds suggests there’s good appetite for riskier bonds with shorter tenors that are less vulnerable to interest rate hikes.】

item.title: 激进派 Cevian 持股 Baloise，加倍看好瑞士金融业
item.description: 激进基金 Cevian Capital AB 成为 Baloise Holding AG 的主要股东，这是继最近入股瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）之后，该基金在瑞士金融业的第二大投资。【原文：Activist fund Cevian Capital AB became a major shareholder in Baloise Holding AG, marking its second big investment in the Swiss finance industry after recently taking a stake in UBS Group AG.】

item.title: 西班牙顶级金融控股公司将增持西班牙电信股份
item.description: 西班牙最大的金融控股公司 CriteriaCaixa SA 正寻求将其在西班牙电信公司（Telefonica SA）的股份增至 10%，以配合西班牙政府的立场。【原文：CriteriaCaixa SA, Spain’s biggest financial holding company, is seeking to increase its stake in Telefonica SA to 10%, matching the Spanish government’s position.】

item.title: 海军恢复演习，油轮再次被迫驶离希腊湾
item.description: 在当地海军再次发出将在该地区进行演习的通知后，少数进入希腊南部海域转运俄罗斯石油的油轮被迫再次离开。【原文：A handful of oil tankers that had entered the waters off southern Greece to transfer Russian petroleum were forced to depart again after the local navy re-issued a notice that it would carry out exercises in the area.】

item.title: 印度 6 万亿美元衍生品狂潮令政府忧心忡忡
item.description: 印度股票衍生品交易量飙升至全球最高水平，这引发了国家政策制定者的担忧，即这种狂热可能会损害将家庭储蓄用于生产目的的努力。【原文：The surge in Indian equity derivatives that’s driven up volumes to the highest in the world is spurring concern among the nation’s policymakers that the frenzy may hurt efforts to harness household savings for productive purposes.】

item.title: 华平投资与淡马锡以 10 亿英镑收购保险服务公司 SRG
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，专注于增长的私募股权公司华平投资集团（Warburg Pincus）正与新加坡淡马锡控股公司（Temasek Holdings Pte）联手收购独立保险中介公司 Specialist Risk Group Ltd. 。【原文：Warburg Pincus, a private equity firm focused on growth, is teaming up with Singapore’s Temasek Holdings Pte to buy Specialist Risk Group Ltd., an independent insurance intermediary, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 道达尔能源公司与合作伙伴批准在安哥拉实施价值 60 亿美元的深水石油项目
item.description: 道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies SE）及其合作伙伴批准了一个价值60亿美元、距安哥拉海岸约100公里（62英里）的深水石油项目，重申了这家法国能源巨头对非洲国家的承诺。【原文：TotalEnergies SE and its partners approved a $6 billion deep-water oil project about 100 kilometers (62 miles) off the coast of Angola, reaffirming the French energy giant’s commitment to the African nation.】

item.title: 面包店交易推动利德尔英国市场份额创历史新高
item.description: Lidl 在英国市场的份额创下历史新高，因为该超市利用烘焙食品的折扣来提高店内销售额。【原文：Lidl’s share of the UK market hit a record high as the supermarket used discounts on baked items to boost in-store sales.】

item.title: 投资者一年内从欧洲房地产基金撤资 100 亿欧元，监管机构对此表示担忧
item.description: 在截至 4 月份的一年中，散户投资者从以欧元计价的房地产基金中撤资 102 亿欧元，因为有人警告说，估值下降可能会给这些产品带来流动性压力。【原文：Retail investors pulled €10.2 billion from euro-denominated real estate funds in the year through April amid warnings that falling valuations could create liquidity pressures for the products.】

item.title: 丹麦经济因制药业生产下降而萎缩
item.description: 丹麦第一季度经济出现萎缩，创下自全球大流行病以来的最大降幅，原因是制药业的增长前景难以实现。【原文：Denmark’s economy contracted in the first quarter, recording the biggest decline since the global pandemic, as growth prospects for the pharmaceutical industry were slow to materialize.】

item.title: 佐治亚交易所上市企业因争议性法案的通过而受到冲击

item.description: 南非最大的私立医院网络正在扩大其初级和家庭护理选择，以进一步扩大患者基础。【原文：South Africa’s largest private hospital network is expanding its primary and home-care options as it seeks to further widen its patient base.】

item.title: 美国称 Glen Point 的菲利普斯应被判入狱两年
item.description: Glen Point Capital 联合创始人尼尔-菲利普斯（Neil Phillips）在一份法庭文件中称，他因操纵美元兑南非兰特汇率而应服刑两年。【原文：Glen Point Capital co-founder Neil Phillips should serve two years in prison for manipulating the US dollar-South African rand exchange rate, federal prosecutors argued in a court filing.】

item.title: 官员称印度可能因现金余额过高而减少债券销售
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，由于现金余额增加，印度今年可能会考虑削减债券销售。【原文：India may consider cutting its bonds sales this year aided by a higher cash balance, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 印度最大石油生产商季度利润超预期
item.description: 印度国营石油和天然气公司公布的季度利润好于预期，原因是运营成本降低和石油产量增加帮助抵消了天然气价格和产量的下降。【原文：India’s state-run Oil and Natural Gas Corp. posted better-than-expected quarterly profits as lower operating costs and increased oil production helped offset a decline in gas prices and output.】

item.title: 尼日利亚货币跌宕起伏，利率将大幅上调
item.description: 尼日利亚奈拉自 4 月中旬以来的大幅下滑和 28 年来的高通胀率很可能使货币政策委员会别无选择，只能再次加息。【原文：A sharp slump in the Nigerian naira since mid-April and 28-year high inflation will likely leave the monetary policy committee with little choice but to hike rates again.】

item.title: 匈牙利将降息半点，政策宽松空间缩小
item.description: 匈牙利可能会连续第二个月将借贷成本下调半个百分点，因为通胀反弹缩小了政策制定者实施更广泛货币宽松政策的空间。【原文：Hungary is likely to cut borrowing costs by half a percentage point for a second month as rebounding inflation narrows policymakers’ scope for more extensive monetary easing.】

item.title: 预测印尼加息的分析师认为印尼还将加息一次
item.description: 唯一准确预测印尼央行最近两次加息的分析师是在新闻编辑室而非交易室磨练出的预测技巧；他预计印尼央行年底前还会加息一次。【原文：The only analyst who accurately predicted both of Bank Indonesia’s most recent interest-rate increases honed his forecasting skills in a newsroom, not a trading room — and he expects one more hike by year-end.】

item.title: 新加坡启动绿色债券销售，刷新全球交易记录
item.description: 新加坡开始销售一种期限约为 30 年的绿色债券，推动了全球销售额的增长，也符合其到 2030 年筹集 350 亿新元（260 亿美元）环境融资的誓言。【原文：Singapore started selling a green bond with a maturity of around 30 years, pushing global sales higher and in-line with its vow to raise S$35 billion ($26 billion) in environment-focused financing by 2030.】

item.title: 创纪录价格抑制需求，中国黄金进口放缓
item.description: 中国上个月的金银进口放缓，因为面对创纪录的价格，世界最大消费国的需求开始疲软。【原文：China’s bullion imports slowed last month as demand in the world’s biggest consumer begins to buckle in the face of record prices.】

item.title: 海外公司寻求仍然低廉的资金，KKR推出日元债券
item.description: KKR & Co.正在销售日元债券，加入了海外发行商在日本央行进一步加息的押注下收益率进一步攀升之前筹集资金的行列。【原文：KKR & Co. is marketing yen bonds, joining overseas issuers raising funds before Japan’s yields climb further on bets of more interest rates hikes by the central bank.】

item.title: 随着股市持续繁荣，大型 IPO 在印度卷土重来
item.description: 印度小规模首次公开募股的热潮可能很快会被更大规模的交易所取代，这将为希望加入印度股票狂潮的全球投资者提供更多选择。【原文：A boom in tiny initial public offerings in India may soon be followed by larger deals, broadening options for global investors looking to join the nation’s equities frenzy.】
